comment: Last year it was the biggest positive surprise for me. I love the original movies and I love this. They kept the spirit of Lethal Weapon and managed to come up with a pair of actors that have an excellent chemistry. I'm really happy this got second season - and I'm hoping there will be more in the future.

Watched Season 2 Episode 1 last night. No spoilers!
I'm so glad that this has returned, still funny, fast and they keep the story line going.

When i first saw it , i was like "Jesus another shitty series from a movie". But then i saw the first episode and the second i was like "This is fun". It really is. It is fun, i love both of the main characters and i say i like this riggs so much better that the original. I am glad it got ot get a second season.

comment:
Fantastic show.

If you have watched the films, you know 90% of the enjoyment comes from the relationship between the two, and the relationship between these two is just fantastic. They knock it out of the park. These two could just sit talking to each other and I'd watch. However the story lines are above average and it ticks along at a nice pace. 

Thought I would hate it, but highly recommend it.
Best TV reboot so far. Macgyver and Rush Hour reboots (which suck) could learn a lot from this show. The casting was great and it's not as cheesey as the other recent TV show remakes.
Probably the best of the lackluster shows this season. While it is not perfect, realistically few shows are. It is one of the best reboots/remakes I have seen.

Started good. A nice mix of funny and the usual cop shenanigans. Nice series, all good. But then the supposed to be funny move of Murtaugh being scared of his wife because she is a tough lawyer (aka just a regular lawyer that always annoys cops Hollywood style). Sprinkled with the usual clich√©s (Murtaugh annoyed by his neighbor because of bigger Xmas decoration... That was just the tip of the iceberg of bad script). 

Ended it after 10 or so episodes. Bummer.
Its growing on me the 1 liners aren't bad either
